results.title: Tasmania's holiday highlands
results.creator_credit: Brian Merrett and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: In the heart of Tasmania’s scenic highlands, a wealth of hydro-electric power is produced through twelve dams and power stations linked by rivers, canals, pipelines and tunnels. These beautiful natural and man-made lakes attract tourists of all kinds, especially hikers and salmon fishermen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Merrett and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production

results.title: Tasmania
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Tasmania’s attractions highlighted in this video range from the picturesque landscapes of Cataract Gorge, Cradle Mountain and Flinders Island to relaxing sporting events such as fishing at London Lakes and viewing the Targa Road Race. Visit historical Port Arthur, Hawley House and the grave of Tom Roberts and indulge in a novelty stop-over at a reproduction Swiss Village.

results.title: Task of the teacher (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lorna Ridgeway, Dan Douglas and Stockwell College of Education

results.title: Tarzan: the collector's classic
results.creator_credit: Wilbur McGaugh, Edward Kull, George W. Stout, Ashton Dearholt, Ben S. Cohen and Ashton Dearholt Expedition Pictures
results.brief_description: This Tarzan collectors edition contains the full length feature “Tarzan and the Green Goddess” starring Olympic champion Herman Brix. Filmed on location in Guatemala, it details the adventures of Tarzan as he assists the expedition of Major Martling and Ula Vale and their quest to take the Green Goddess, a native totem believed to contain a secret formula for a super explosive, back to Livingston. After successfully finding the totem it is stolen by Raglan who is intent on using the formula for Hiram Power’s personal plots, thus disturbing the delicate balance of the jungle. With only Tarzan’s unique knowledge to rectify the chaos that has been unleashed, so follows the journey on the trail of Raglan. Tarzan and the expedition members must also combat a party of natives sent by the High Priest to avenge the tribe and retrieve the Goddess. This Tarzan collectors edition also contains bonus footage, extracts and out-takes from the films of three other well known Tarzan players, including the first actor to play Edgar Rice Burrough’s adventurous character, Elmo Lincoln.

results.title: Tarzan, the ape man
results.creator_credit: W S. Van Dyke and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Tarzan, a man raised from childhood by apes, meets Jane, a young English woman on safari with her father. Based on the characters created by Edgar Rice Burroughs. Cast includes Johnny Weissmuller, Neil Hamilton, C. Aubrey Smith, Maureen o’Sullivan.

results.title: Tarzan and his mate
results.creator_credit: Jack Conway, Cedric Gibbons, Bernard H. Hyman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The second Tarzan film starring Johnny Weissmuller who succeeded Elmo Lincoln (the ‘silent’ Tarzan) as the King of the Apes finds him settled with the Englishwoman Jane in their jungle domain until disturbed by two white hunters from Mayfair (one a former beau of Jane’s) in search of ivory. The thirties MGM series, of which Tarzan and His Mate is widely considered to be the best, had above average production values (set designer Cedric Gibbons is credited here as co-director) with well staged action in the studio jungle. Pre-dating the stiffening of the industry censorship code in the thirties, Tarzan and His Mate is considerably less coy about sexuality than the later entrants in the series. Cast also includes Maureen O’Sullivan, Neil Hamilton, Paul Cavanagh, Forrester Harvey, Nathan Curry.

results.title: Tarzan (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Chris Buck, Kevin Lima, Bonnie Arnold and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Disney brings Edgar Rice Burroughs’ story ‘Tarzan’ to life in this full length animated film. Tarzan is a baby boy, adopted by a gorilla named Kala, following the death of her own child. She brings him into the group against the wishes of their leader, a large silverback gorilla named Kerchak. Tarzan quickly makes friends with a gorilla named Terk, and an elephant named Tantor despite his obvious differences. Tarzan grows up believing he is one of the gorillas - until he meets Jane. This event changes Tarzan’s life as he learns about who and what he really is. Featuring five songs written and performed by Phil Collins including the Oscar winning song “You’ll be in my heart”, and the voices of Glenn Close, Rosie O’Donnell, Minnie Driver, Wayne Knight, Nigel Hawthorne and Alex D. Linz as the voice of young Tarzan.

holdings.name: MPEG-4 Digital File; ACMI Digital Access Copy - overscan

results.title: Tarot: strictly supernatural
results.creator_credit: Justin Hardy, Ludo Graham, Andre Singer and Non Fiction Films
results.brief_description: An informative look at tarot cards and tarot card reading, centering around the mysterious origins of the cards themselves, and the way their meanings and usage have changed over the centuries. Tarot card readers, historians, and parapsychologists discuss the appeal of the tarot, and offer anecdotes and theories as to why people are so drawn to this ancient craft. Also explores the symbolism behind the artwork, the different spreads that can be used in a reading, and the meanings of the major and minor arcana. Narrated by Christopher Lee.

results.title: Taronga
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Collings and Taronga Zoological Park Trust
results.brief_description: Taronga, which is an aboriginal name for beautiful view, is the home of the extensive collection of animals and birds of the Zoological Trust on the North Shore of Sydney Harbour. The film follows a party of children on their tour of the grounds and shows koalas, emus, kangaroos and Australian birds as well as the larger animals from overseas. Amusements available to the children include being allowed to hold and feed baby animals in the nursery and to go for rides on elephants and miniature trains.
